multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a growth on my left foot that has been increasing in size for the past year and it's become painful.
Have you noticed any changes in color or bleeding from the growth?
Yes, the growth is brown and the skin over it is crusted and tends to break easily.
Do you have any similar growths elsewhere on your body?
No, there are no similar growths elsewhere on my body.
Do you have a history of excessive sun exposure or sunburns, particularly on your feet?
I have no significant past medical history mentioned, including anything related to sun exposure or sunburns.
Does anyone in your family have a history of skin cancer or unusual skin growths?
I don't have any information about my family's medical history regarding skin cancer or unusual skin growths.
Is the growth hard or soft when you press on it?
The growth is mildly tender when I press on it.
Final Diagnosis: Squamous Cell Carcinoma
